info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 14 at 5:49PM EDT until July 14 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR NORTHERN MACOMB AND SOUTHEASTERN ST. CLAIR COUNTIES... At 548 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Memphis to near Richmond to near Armada, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... New Baltimore around 615 PM EDT. Marine City around 630 PM EDT. Algonac and Harsens Island around 640 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Anchorville, New Haven, Adair, Columbus, Rattle Run, Pearl Beach, Ray Center, Chesterfield Township and Fair Haven. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
